docs.text: Ibon Martínez-Arranz # I hold a PhD in Mathematics by training, and I’ve become a Data Scientist by passion Ibon Martínez-Arranz Welcome to my personal website! I'm Ibon Martínez-Arranz, a Data Science expert specializing in Machine Learning and statistical analysis. Hi there! I'm Ibon Martínez-Arranz — a PhD in Mathematics, passionate about statistics, data science, and the stories data can tell. My journey began at the University of the Basque Country (EHU/UPV), where I earned my BSc in Mathematics. I then completed two MSc degrees: one in Applied Statistical Techniques and another in Mathematical Modeling, building a strong foundation for analytical thinking and complex problem-solving. In 2010, I joined OWL Metabolomics ( currently Rubió Metabolomics ), where I currently lead the Data Science Department. My work focuses on machine learning, predictive modeling, and statistical analysis applied to metabolomics and biomedical research. This site brings together my CV and personal projects, showcasing my experience in data science, genetic algorithms, Python, R, and beyond. Welcome—and I hope you enjoy exploring the work I’m passionate about!
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE # Currently # Ibon Martínez-Arranz got his BSc. in Mathematics from the University of the Basque Country (EHU/UPV) and performed a MSc. in Current Applied Statistics Techniques and a MSc. in Mathematical Modeling Research, Statistical Analysis and Computing Sciences. In 2004, he joined the Basque Country Health Service (The Department of Health of the Basque Country Government and Osakidetza) as a data analyst and his work was mainly focused on the epidemiological report of renal patients. When he joined OWL Metabolomics in 2010, Ibon first worked as a researcher in the Metabolomics Department and in 2017, he became the head of the Data Science Department, being responsible for prediction and statistical computation management since then. This highly experienced team psupports metabolomics services, laboratory processes, data handling, R&D projects and technology transfer processes. I completed my doctoral thesis entitled “Genetic Algorithms Applied to Translational Strategy in NASH. Learning from Mouse Models” under the supervision of José María Mato (General Director of CIC bioGUNE) and Dae-Jin (Data Science line leader of Basque Center for Applied Mathematics, BCAM). In this work, I applied genetic algorithms for the selection of NAFLD subtypes, a procedure that can be extended to any disease based on metabolic changes. The results also have significant implications in the field of precision medicine. Employment # 2023 Rubió Metabolomics Data Science Manager . docs.text: SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT # OwlStatApp # Metabolomics research has evolved considerably, particularly during the last decade. Over the course of this evolution, the interest in this omic discipline is now more evident than ever. However, the future of metabolomics will depend on its capability to find biomarkers. For that reason, data mining constitutes a challenging task in metabolomics workflow, being a time-consuming issue which usually requires detailed knowledge of bioinformatics, statistics and specialized software. We have developed OWL Stat App, an easy-to-use web application for metabolomics data analysis. It combines powerful univariate and multivariate data analysis with pathway mapping tools and visualization capacities to facilitate interpretation of the results. | OwlStatApp | AgingAnalysis # Metabolomics research has evolved considerably, particularly during the last decade. Over the course of this evolution, the interest in this omic discipline is now more evident than ever. However, the future of metabolomics will depend on its capability to find biomarkers. For that reason, data mining constitutes a challenging task in metabolomics workflow. This work has been designed in support of the research article entitled Enhancing metabolomics research through data mining, which proposed a methodological data handling guideline. An aging research in healthy population was used as a guiding thread to illustrate this process. Here we provide a further interpretation of the obtained statistical results. We also focused on the importance of graphical visualization tools as a clue to understand the most common univariate and multivariate data analyses applied in metabolomics. | AgingAnalysis | PyGenMet # A Python package for Genetics Algorithms. | PyGenMet | Manual |

docs.text: Metabolomics research has evolved considerably, particularly during the last decade. Over the course of this evolution, the interest in this omic discipline is now more evident than ever. However, the future of metabolomics will depend on its capability to find biomarkers. For that reason, data mining constitutes a challenging task in metabolomics workflow, being a time-consuming issue which usually requires detailed knowledge of bioinformatics, statistics and specialized software. We have developed OWL Stat App, an easy-to-use web application for metabolomics data analysis. It combines powerful univariate and multivariate data analysis with pathway mapping tools and visualization capacities to facilitate interpretation of the results. | OwlStatApp |
docs.title: OwlStatApp

docs.text: Metabolomics research has evolved considerably, particularly during the last decade. Over the course of this evolution, the interest in this omic discipline is now more evident than ever. However, the future of metabolomics will depend on its capability to find biomarkers. For that reason, data mining constitutes a challenging task in metabolomics workflow. This work has been designed in support of the research article entitled Enhancing metabolomics research through data mining, which proposed a methodological data handling guideline. An aging research in healthy population was used as a guiding thread to illustrate this process. Here we provide a further interpretation of the obtained statistical results. We also focused on the importance of graphical visualization tools as a clue to understand the most common univariate and multivariate data analyses applied in metabolomics. | AgingAnalysis |

docs.text: GitHub Projects # data-science-workflow-management # This repository is a collection of code, documentation, and other resources that support the management and automation of a Data Science project. essential-guide-to-pandas # A comprehensive guide to mastering Pandas for data analysis, featuring practical examples, real-world case studies, and step-by-step tutorials. pygenmet # Genetic Algorithms Applied to Translational Strategy in NASH. Learning from Mouse Models aventuras-programacion-python-isla-del-tesoro # Este proyecto está dedicado a crear un libro de programación en Python diseñado especialmente para niños. Inspirado en la clásica novela "La Isla del Tesoro" de Robert Louis Stevenson, este libro ofrece una serie de lecciones para ir aprendiendo Python y programación con ejercicios y ejemplos de piratas. cl4ds # En este repositorio encontrarás manuales para software de línea de comandos con un enfoque a su aplicación en ciencia de datos. modelling-football-scores # My aim to develop a model that predicts the scores of football matches. My code (python) implements various machine learning algorithms to analyze team and player statistics, as well as historical match data to make informed predictions. nagel-schreckenberg-model # Repositorio que contiene una implementación en Python del modelo de Nagel-Schreckenberg para la simulación de tráfico en carreteras. Este modelo proporciona una herramienta sencilla pero efectiva para explorar el comportamiento del tráfico de vehículos y estudiar fenómenos de congestión en carreteras. lotr-zipf-law-application # Análisis de 'El Señor de los Anillos' mediante la Ley de Zipf: un estudio detallado de la distribución de frecuencias de palabras en la trilogía de Tolkien para explorar la aplicabilidad de esta fascinante ley estadística en la literatura épica. cifras-y-letras # Librería en Python diseñada para el concurso televisivo del mismo nombre. Su objetivo es encontrar la palabra más larga posible a partir de 10 letras aleatorias, utilizando el Diccionario de la Lengua Española como referencia. La librería permite analizar letras rápidamente y cuenta con funciones específicas. data-science-library-hub # This repository is a curated list of essential Data Science libraries, showcasing the core tools like Pandas and NumPy for data manipulation, as well as innovative libraries such as Seaborn and PyCaret for advanced data visualization and automated machine learning workflows. data-science-book-hub # A curated collection of essential Data Science books, featuring foundational and advanced texts on analytical techniques, data visualization, and machine learning. This selection spans introductory to specialized guides, covering tools like Python, R, and more, suitable for both beginners and experts.

docs.text: Este proyecto está dedicado a crear un libro de programación en Python diseñado especialmente para niños. Inspirado en la clásica novela "La Isla del Tesoro" de Robert Louis Stevenson, este libro ofrece una serie de lecciones para ir aprendiendo Python y programación con ejercicios y ejemplos de piratas.
docs.title: aventuras-programacion-python-isla-del-tesoro

docs.text: En este repositorio encontrarás manuales para software de línea de comandos con un enfoque a su aplicación en ciencia de datos.
docs.title: cl4ds

docs.text: My aim to develop a model that predicts the scores of football matches. My code (python) implements various machine learning algorithms to analyze team and player statistics, as well as historical match data to make informed predictions.
docs.title: modelling-football-scores

docs.text: Repositorio que contiene una implementación en Python del modelo de Nagel-Schreckenberg para la simulación de tráfico en carreteras. Este modelo proporciona una herramienta sencilla pero efectiva para explorar el comportamiento del tráfico de vehículos y estudiar fenómenos de congestión en carreteras.
docs.title: nagel-schreckenberg-model

docs.text: Análisis de 'El Señor de los Anillos' mediante la Ley de Zipf: un estudio detallado de la distribución de frecuencias de palabras en la trilogía de Tolkien para explorar la aplicabilidad de esta fascinante ley estadística en la literatura épica.
docs.title: lotr-zipf-law-application

docs.text: Librería en Python diseñada para el concurso televisivo del mismo nombre. Su objetivo es encontrar la palabra más larga posible a partir de 10 letras aleatorias, utilizando el Diccionario de la Lengua Española como referencia. La librería permite analizar letras rápidamente y cuenta con funciones específicas.
docs.title: cifras-y-letras

docs.text: This repository is a curated list of essential Data Science libraries, showcasing the core tools like Pandas and NumPy for data manipulation, as well as innovative libraries such as Seaborn and PyCaret for advanced data visualization and automated machine learning workflows.
docs.title: data-science-library-hub

docs.text: A curated collection of essential Data Science books, featuring foundational and advanced texts on analytical techniques, data visualization, and machine learning. This selection spans introductory to specialized guides, covering tools like Python, R, and more, suitable for both beginners and experts.
docs.title: data-science-book-hub

docs.text: Data Science Competitions # Lantik Datathon 2022 # Participated in a collaborative development competition aimed at creating innovative applications to address public needs in Bizkaia using Open Data. Teams were challenged to develop a mockup and a solution proposal that incorporated data from various sources. 🏆 Finalist Learn more about the Lantik Datathon Kopuru Traffic Prediction Challenge # Competed in a challenge to predict traffic at the entrance of an industrial estate in the Basque Country. docs.text: PATENTS GRANTED AND PENDING # WO2021028562 # Lipid signatures for determining the outcome of embryo implantation during in vitro fertilization , The present invention relates to new methods for predicting the outcome of in vitro fertilization (IVF) procedures, as well as selecting the subjects to undergo IVF treatments. It also relates to methods for selecting IVF treatments and decision-making in said treatments as well as wash solutions for use in the treatment of infertility. ID Patent: PCT/EP2020/072846 WO2018007511 # Diagnostic methods based on lipid profiles , The present invention relates to methods for the diagnosis of NAFLD in a subject, and for the differential diagnosis of NASH or steatosis in a subject suffering from NAFLD, based on the determination in a sample of metabolic markers, particularly lipid metabolic markers. ID Patent: EP16382320.6 WO2018007422 # Identification of human Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) subtypes , The present invention is directed to a profiling method for subtypes in non- alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) patients and to diagnostic methods within those subtypes to discriminate non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) versus steatosis patients. ID Patent: EP16382319.8 WO2017055397 # Metabolomic signature of diagnosis and disease progression in Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) , The present invention is directed to a diagnostic method for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and to a method for monitoring the progression of the disease based on the determination of the levels of different metabolites. The invention also provides a method for determining the efficacy of an NAFLD therapy and a method for identification of compounds suitable for the treatment of NAFLD. ID Patent: EP15382477.6

docs.text: Biographical Sketch # NAME : Ibon Martínez Arranz POSITION TITLE : Data Science Manager at OWL EDUCATION/TRAINING : INSTITUTION AND LOCATION DEGREE COMPLETION DATE FIELD OF STUDY University of Basque Country (UPV/EHU) (Biscay, Spain) BSc. 06/2003 Mathematics National University of Distance Education (Spain) Expert degree 07/2007 Statistics Applied to Health Sciences National University of Distance Education (Spain) Expert degree 07/2008 Advanced Methods of Applied Statistics National University of Distance Education (Spain) MSc. 07/2012 Current Applied Statistics Techniques National University of Distance Education (Spain) Expert degree 07/2013 Multivariate Statistical Techniques University of Basque Country (UPV/EHU) (Biscay, Spain) MSc. 05/2016 Mathematical Modeling, Statistical Analysis and Computation University of basque Country (UPV/EHU) (Biscay, Spain) Ongoing PhD. Expected 2021 Applied Mathematics Currently, I am doing a doctoral thesis entitled “Genetic Algorithms Applied to Translational Strategy in NASH. Learning from Mouse Models” under the supervision of José María Mato (General Director of CIC bioGUNE) and Dae-Jin (Data Science line leader of Basque Center for Applied Mathematics, BCAM) in which I apply genetic algorithms for the selection of NAFLD subtypes. This procedure could be applied to any disease that is based on metabolic changes. This work also has implications in the field of precision medicine. A. Personal Statement # Ibon Martínez-Arranz got his BSc. in Mathematics from the University of the Basque Country (EHU/UPV) and performed a MSc. in Current Applied Statistics Techniques and a MSc. in Mathematical Modeling Research, Statistical Analysis and Computing Sciences. In 2004, he joined the Basque Country Health Service (The Department of Health of the Basque Country Government and Osakidetza) as a data analyst and his work was mainly focused on the epidemiological report of renal patients. When he joined OWL Metabolomics in 2010, Ibon first worked as a researcher in the Metabolomics Department and in 2017, he became the head of the Data Science Department, being responsible for prediction and statistical computation management since then. This high experience provide support to metabolomics services, laboratory processes, data handling, R&D projects and technology transfer processes. B. Positions and Honors # Head of Data Science Department at OWL. (2017 - to date). Researcher in Metabolomics Department at OWL Metabolomics. (2010 - 2017). C. Contributions to Science # Author of 22 publications Google Scholar H-index = 14 Researcher unique identifier ORCID Scopus pubmed Data mining of 'omics' data # 'Omics' research generates a large amount of data for every sample. OWL has established a well-defined workflow and a set of guidelines for analyzing omics data. It includes statistical design of experiments, data structuration and predictive modelling. Peer-reviewed papers: Martínez-Arranz, I, et al . Enhancing metabolomics research through data mining, J. Proteomics, 2015;127(B)275-288. Barr J, et al . Obesity-dependent metabolic signatures associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease progression. J. Proteome Res 2012;11(4),2521-32 Arbelaiz A, et al . Serum extracellular vesicles contain protein biomarkers for primary sclerosing cholangitis and cholangiocarcinoma. Hepatology. 2017; 10.1002/hep.29291. Cano A, et al . A Metabolomics Signature Linked To Liver Fibrosis In The Serum Of Transplanted Hepatitis C Patients. Scientific Reports. 2017;7(1):10497. Predictive algorithms for disease diagnosis # We have developed predictive algorithms for several diseases. We have been really involved in the development and validation of the OWLiver, OWLiver F2+ and OWLiver DM2 tests. Peer-reviewed papers: Barr J, et al . Obesity-dependent metabolic signatures associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease progression. J. Proteome Res. 2012;11(4):2521-32. Cano A, et al . A Metabolomics Signature Linked To Liver Fibrosis In The Serum Of Transplanted Hepatitis C Patients. Scientific Reports. 2017;7(1):10497. Herreros-Villanueva M, et al . Plasma MicroRNA Signature Validation for Early Detection of Colorectal Cancer. Clin Transl Gastroenterol. 2019 Jan;10(1). Matorras R, et al . The lipidome of endometrial fluid differs between implantative and non-implantative IVF cycles. J Assist Reprod Genet. 2020;37(2):385-94. Martínez-Arranz I, et al . Metabolomic-based noninvasive serum test to diagnose nonalcoholic steatohepatitis: Results from discovery and validation cohorts. Hepatol Commun. 2018 May 4;2(7):807-820. Selected publications focused in Machine Learning and Modelling (within last 5 years) # Peer-reviewed papers: Alonso C, et al . Metabolomic Identification of Subtypes of Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis. Gastroenterology 2017;152(6):1449-61. Iruarrizaga-Lejarreta M, et al . Role of Aramchol in steatohepatitis and fibrosis in mice. Hepatology Communications 2017;1(9):911-27. Banales JM, et al . In 2004, he joined the Basque Country Health Service (The Department of Health of the Basque Country Government and Osakidetza) as a data analyst and his work was mainly focused on the epidemiological report of renal patients. When he joined OWL Metabolomics in 2010, Ibon first worked as a researcher in the Metabolomics Department and in 2017, he became the head of the Data Science Department, being responsible for prediction and statistical computation management since then. This high experience provide support to metabolomics services, laboratory processes, data handling, R&D projects and technology transfer processes.
